title: How to turn off?
comment: I love the concept.  When I installed to test (set to 1 minute intervals) , it continued to notify (ring and vibrate) with no apparent way to stop it (it notified continuously)   When I cleared the notifications and voicemail, it started notifying again.  I had to force close it.  I would like to know how it is supposed to work.  I'm giving 3 stars because it does notify again, which I want.  Would be 5 star plus if it followed it protocol.

title: Ta
comment: Gvd

comment: Didn't seem to work. Wish it did.

comment: Note reports as not working

title: Remove the notification icon!
comment: Option to control visibility if the notification icon is a must. A notification that I'm looking for notifications is redundant.

title: Slipping...
comment: Used to work like a dream.  Noticed over past few weeks/phone updates that this app is hit and miss.  Sometimes it will notify, more often not. Droidx
Can't hide notification icon, lacks flexibility. NoLED is much better!	Nexus S

title: Good, but needs a few tweaks
comment: I was forever missing texts and emails, and this has solved that problem really nicely. :) Two problems though: 1. (minor nit) The notification item should only show when it's actually been activated, and should be dismissable same as any other notification. 2. The vibrate feature should be disabled when the phone is on silent (as opposed to vibrate mode)! Buzzing in your pocket at the cinema might be ok, but all on a night-stand it's really annoying!
Had high hopes for this. Doesn't work at all. Samsung Galaxy S2...

title: Not all functions work on Epic 4G
comment: I'm looking for a good notification app but this isn't there yet. It only does my regular e-mail. It didn't work for G-mail or text messages. I didn't try voicemail yet. Would like to see this app have more time choices, and also work for the calendar. I do like that it uses your ring tones! I wouldn't mind paying for this app if it worked more efficiently and was more flexable!
The only reason I don't use this app is cause its showmen in the status bar

title: GREAT APP
comment: Looks like lots of updates since the Feb release - includes ability to select notifications by type. How do we get most recent updates? Would like to have for multiple mail accounts and VM!

title: Does what it is supposed to however...
comment: The configuration notification never goes away. Droid Inc 2...

Simple and effective. Provides a very useful missing feature. Would like to disable the notification icon and entry - it adds no value. Desire 2.2
